intro: Facelis retusa var. andicola, commonly known as the Andean faceleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its attractive, palmate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the cooler months. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
